ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A very very strong introduction to the Novelas ejemplares. I would highly recommend it.

I would highly recommend this course to a fellow student because it provided the opportunity to analyze the Novelas ejemplares in depth and to acquire various critical methods for approaching Cervantes.

An excellent course on Cervantes' Novelas ejemplares. Excellent professor. If you're interested in Cervantes or in Early Modern Spanish literature, and if you want to have the opportunity to read Cervantes' Novelas with a truly great professor, take this course.
Yes, because it gives you another perspective of literature as an experiment.
I recommend them to take it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel like I have a better handle on Cervantes, although the course is a bit limited in scope. I think I learned how to read with a better eye for detail, but I would not say that it directly contributed to my dissertation or research in terms of the material covered.
This course has deepened my overall knowledge of Cervantes, Golden Age prose fiction, and the intellectual/cultural/political context of 16th and 17th century Spain.

This course has helped me gain a better understanding of the breadth of Cervantes' work as well as deepened my knowledge of the history and literature of Early Modern Spain. Given the relevance of Cervantes, I expect this course to contribute to my dissertation research.
It help me because Cevante's is an author that one must know.
It prepares you well for the doctoral exams.
